translation: It's said today is the end of the world, and you must be very disappointed as the world is still spinning.
transcript: 今天世界末日，地球没有毁灭，让大家失望了吧。

translation: But somebody said to me, "wait, we don't know if the sun would rise tomorrow."
transcript: 但是有人告诉我说，别着急，明天太阳能不能升起来还不知道。

translation: In fact, the apocalypse doesn't frighten me at all, but I'm a little worried.
transcript: 其实我想想，好像世界末日也没什么可怕的，但我有一点点担心。

translation: For me, it's ok if we perish together.
transcript: 我的担心是，同归于尽并不可怕。

translation: But I worry that when I die, you are still living in this world.
transcript: 我在担心什么呢？就是我死了，你还活着。

translation: This is so unfair.
transcript: 所以世界是不公平的。

translation: How do we start to ask questions?
transcript: 我们的问题从哪儿开始呢？

translation: When I was little, I started asking the most basic questions.
transcript: 我的起点非常低，小的时候我问的第一个问题应该就是。

translation: The first of them was where I came from.
transcript: 我从哪里来。

translation: My mom gave me an answer.
transcript: 这个问题是我妈妈回答我的。

translation: She said, "You are fished out from a river".
transcript: 她说：“你是河里捞的。”

translation: Many years later, because of the nature of my job, I met many bigwigs.
transcript: 后来由于职业的原因，我见到了很多所谓的大人物。

translation: And I asked them where they came from.
transcript: 我也问过他们这个问题。

translation: Many of them were told that they were found in trash cans.
transcript: 很多大人物都是从垃圾桶里捡的。

translation: Knowing that today's host, Jiang Changjian, is also from trash cans, I feel so much better.
transcript: 今天蒋昌建在主持，他也是垃圾桶里捡的，这样我就放心了。

translation: We usually ask questions out of curiosity.
transcript: 所以我们很多的问题是从好奇心开始的。

translation: But questions after questions, once our curiosity is appeased, may result from misunderstanding.
transcript: 但好奇心之后一连串的问题无穷无尽，却往往开始于误解。

translation: The world has seen so many misunderstanings.
transcript: 这个世界有那么多那么多的误解。

translation: By becoming a man who makes a living by asking questions, I may add another misunderstanding to this world.
transcript: 可是我竟然成了一个靠提问为生的人，这也是一个误会。

translation: I never see myself as a wise talker.
transcript: 我从来都不认为自己是一个会说话的人。

translation: Since childhood, if somebody asked me to do something as simple as talking to others, I could get cold feet.
transcript: 从小到大，如果有人跟我讲，你要去做一件事情，这件事情简单到你去找一个人跟他讲一句话就成功了，可是我就真心在那儿纠结。

translation: I once looked up to a man who had an exceptionally big mouth.
transcript: 后来我曾经有过一个非常仰慕的男人，他的特征很明显就是嘴特别大。

translation: It could have been very romantic if that big mouth was used to eat or kiss.
transcript: 长着这么一张大嘴，如果用来吃饭和接吻是非常好的一件事儿。

translation: Sadly, this man used his mouth to talk, for which he was killed at last.
transcript: 可他偏偏用来说话，后来掉了脑袋。

translation: He is Socrates.
transcript: 这个人叫苏格拉底。

translation: Socrates's story often has me thinking how hard it is to talk.
transcript: 所以我常常想，说话究竟是一个多难的事情呢。

translation: Just as mouth is not only for eating, we talk not only to inform people, but also to clear misunderstandings.
transcript: 我们长这张嘴，不单纯是为了吃饭，我们说话也不单纯是为了让别人知道，很多时候我们就是为了消除误解。

translation: However, it really racks our brains to come up with a good question.
transcript: 可是问一个好问题真的是非常的难。

translation: I have been asking questions for a living for a long time.
transcript: 我做这个以提问为生的职业已经有不算短的一段时间。

translation: And I feel lucky because my job is as simple as posing questions, and well-paid.
transcript: 那当然，这个职业靠着问问题可以拿工资，而且工资还不低，这让我觉得自己很幸运。

translation: According to my calculation, I have asked over 30 thousand questions in more than 10 years as a TV talk show host.
transcript: 我算了一下，做了十多年的电视谈话类节目，加起来我问过的问题大概有三万多个吧。

translation: If I compile those questions into a book, it must be a very thick one, equivalent of the book I have read in my childhood—I Wonder Why.
transcript: 小时候看过一套书叫《十万个为什么》，那如果把我这三万多个问题变成书，它也应该有很厚很厚的一本。

translation: Sometimes I think to myself, my god, how stupid my book would sound.
transcript: 有时我在想，天呐，那得有多愚蠢呀这本书。

translation: I have asked many terrible questions, and I have also got headache and insomnia for drying up my inspiration to ask questions.
transcript: 我问过很多烂问题，我也常常因为问不出问题会头疼、失眠。

translation: As you know, my peer Cui Yongyuan, a Chinese TV talk show host, has insomnia too.
transcript: 当然我的同行崔永元也失眠，不过我比他好看一点。

translation: But I guess being more handsome helps me earn more sympathy than him.
transcript: 所以更容易获得同情。

translation: In retrospect, how did I come up with those questions?
transcript: 我就在想，那我问过的问题中，是从哪儿开始的呢？

translation: What is a good question?
transcript: 那么什么是好问题？

translation: And what is a terrible one?
transcript: 什么又是烂问题呢？

translation: As a matter of fact, it is still beyond my ability to answer these two questions.
transcript: 实际上到现在我也回答不了。

translation: I don't have a clue about what is a good question.
transcript: 我根本不知道什么叫做好问题。

translation: Although ignorant of how to tell a good question, I'm so clear in mind about what a terrible question is like.
transcript: 可是问过这么多问题之后，我知道什么叫做烂问题。

translation: Most terrible questions are superficial.
transcript: 那些烂问题都是轻而易举的，非常容易。

translation: For example, Sophie Marceau has been asked which role she likes most for more than 1 thousand times.
transcript: 比如说苏菲玛索被问过一千多次你最喜欢哪个角色。

translation: Someone once asked Li Zehou what he did for a living.
transcript: 李泽厚被问过说，你是干什么的。

translation: There is another terrible question asked by a young journalist who was my co-worker when interviewing the nationwide idol Ge You.
transcript: 还有我的一个同事，我见过一个很年轻的记者，他要去采访葛优，那当然葛大爷是国宝，人人都喜欢，老少咸宜。

translation: What should he prepare to nail it? More importantly, he also adores Ge You.
transcript: 那问题是他也崇拜葛大爷，那么要怎么问呢。

translation: He took that interview very seriously.
transcript: 他很认真，头一天晚上做功课。

translation: He wrote down the questions in a paper and practiced them over and over again in front of the mirror.
transcript: 自己对着镜子反复练习，然后把他的问题写下来写在一页纸上。

translation: I had checked that paper, and there were about 500 words.
transcript: 我看到那页纸，上面有500多个字。

translation: As the interview just begun, he started reading the paper to Ge You in case he should forget any details.
transcript: 他怕自己忘了，所以见到葛大爷就拿着纸开始念。

translation: In his mind, this would never be a terrible question.
transcript: 这总归不会是很差的一个问题吧。

translation: But when he finished reading, Ge You answered in this manner, "Well, I think you have asked a very funny question".
transcript: 等他把这个问题问完之后，葛大爷是这么回答的：“对，我觉得你说的有点儿意思。”

translation: If I were that journalist, I would have sweated right away on hearing such a reply.
transcript: 如果是我，我估计汗就下来了。

translation: Even now I often ask some terrible questions like he did.
transcript: 可是到现在我也常常会问一些让自己流汗的问题。

translation: After all, a good question is really hard won.
transcript: 所以一个真正的好问题并不那么容易获得。

translation: I have to practice many times.
transcript: 我需要很多次练习。

translation: It is strange that whenever I tell others that I am not smart, they seem not to believe it.
transcript: 我常常跟别人说我特别笨，那奇怪的是好像他们不太相信。

translation: As a result, I have to practice over and over again behind the scene.
transcript: 所以我只好非常小心地很谨慎地一遍一遍地躲起来练。

translation: Where did I start the practice?
transcript: 这个练习从哪里开始？

translation: In 1999, when I was making a documentary program in Beijing, I shot a video named Brothers during an interview.
transcript: 1999年，我在北京，我做一档纪录片节目，当时去采访，我记得我拍了一个片子叫做：兄弟。

translation: The video is based on a true story that happened in Shangdong.
transcript: 是一个真实的故事，它发生在山东呃。

translation: There are two brothers sticking together and helping each other in difficulties since they lost their parents.
transcript: 父母双亡之后，兄弟两个人相依为命。

translation: In order to raise the younger brother, the elder brother dropped out of school to make money.
transcript: 哥哥为了供养弟弟去打工辍学，后来弟弟考上了大学。

translation: Later, he even paid the younger brother's college tuition by selling his blood.
transcript: 哥哥卖血给弟弟交了学费。

translation: The younger brother studied computer in college, and he planned to join a computer skill training.
transcript: 后来弟弟学了计算机专业，在学校里面要去上一个技能的培训课。

translation: What will he do to pay the training fee?
transcript: 那么要交一笔钱，家里头没有这个钱怎么办呢？

translation: At that time, the elder brother was toiling at a constructions site during the daytime, and in a computer company at night as a security guard.
transcript: 哥哥当时白天在一个工地做事儿，晚上在一家电脑公司当保安。

translation: At the end of his resources, he made a stuipid and possibly the only choice.
transcript: 所以他做了一个很愚蠢的选择，可能也是迫不得已的选择。

translation: He colluded with a criminal gang to steal 4 computers from the company he worked for.
transcript: 他呃勾结外面的一个犯罪团伙，盗窃了自己的公司四台电脑。

translation: A computer was worth over CNY 10,000 in 1999, as a result,  he may be sentenced to 10 years in prison accumulatively.
transcript: 在当年一台电脑大概一万多块钱，所以这个总额加起来他可能会被判刑10年。

translation: After sending his younger brother some money, he absconded.
transcript: 呃，他给弟弟寄了一笔钱就逃跑了。

translation: Then, the law enforcers came to the younger brother for cooperation. Being asked to place righteousness above family loyalty, the younger brother promised to help capture his elder brother.
transcript: 后来执法人员就找到了弟弟说你要大义灭亲，那么弟弟就答应了配合。

translation: When his elder brother contacted him again, he lied that he was seriously ill.
transcript: 在哥哥再一次联系他的时候，他告诉哥哥他生了重病。

translation: Hearing this bad news, the elder brother came to his college at all hazards, but got caught finally.
transcript: 哥哥就冒了很大的风险到学校去看望他，嗯，就被抓捕归案。

translation: I was very young at that time.
transcript: 那那个时候我非常的年轻。

translation: I, along with the cameramen, directors and other staff, conducted this special interview.
transcript: 我带着我们的摄像还有我们的导演和工作人员，去做这个专题的采访。

translation: After much ado, we were permitted to interview the younger brother and the elder brother in the prison.
transcript: 我们好不容易获得了机会，不但见到了弟弟，还被批准到监狱里面去采访哥哥。

translation: The two brothers didn't look like the same at all.
transcript: 这兄弟两个人长得非常的不像。

translation: One common feature that I remembered clearly was that they both had thick lips.
transcript: 但是他们两个有一个特点，我记得非常清楚，两个人嘴唇都厚厚的。

translation: Whenever I mentioned the one to the other, both the elder and younger brothers demonstrated a same expression and dropped on tongue, with lips shaking.
transcript: 在我说出他们的名字的时候，无论是哥哥还是弟弟，提到自己的兄弟一句话也说不出来，厚厚的嘴唇在发抖，两个人有共同的表情。

translation: Words failed me when I saw the expression on the elder brother's face.
transcript: 我看着那个哥哥的表情，我什么问题也问不出来。

translation: Many years later, I became a journalist in the Department of Special Contribution in a newspaper office.
transcript: 好多年过去，我在一家报纸做特稿部的记者。

translation: Actually, I was only in my twenties then.
transcript: 那个时候我还很年轻，20多岁。

translation: One day, an elder came to our office, on whose face the expression reminded me of the brothers instantly.
transcript: 有一天我们办公室里来了一个老人家，这个老人家的表情一下子就让我想到了那对兄弟。

translation: Through the traces on their faces left by life, one can tell what they have been through.
transcript: 他们脸上可以看得到生活穿越过去的样子。

translation: Therefore, I have to sigh that how complicated the human nature is.
transcript: 所以我就在想人性是复杂的。

translation: When the elder came in, I had no idea what he planned to do.
transcript: 当这个老人家进来的时候，我不知道他要干什么。

translation: He carried with a woven bag that you all are familiar with, put it down, and then took something out wordlessly.
transcript: 他拿了一个你们知道那个编织袋吧，放在地上，不说话，开始往外掏。

translation: What is it?
transcript: 什么东西呢？

translation: Files for his appeal.
transcript: 上诉材料。

translation: He put all the materials on my desk, piling them up to a height like this, still without a word spoken.
transcript: 全部放在我的桌子上，这么高，还是不说话。

translation: Finally, I asked him a question while looking at him, "what are you going to do?"
transcript: 我看着他，我终于问了一个问题，“你要干什么呢？”

translation: Suddenly, he kneeled down.
transcript: 他突然就跪下了。

translation: As our floor is tiled, I could clearly hear the crisp "clang" sound when his kneeled down on the tiles.
transcript: 我们办公室的地板是瓷砖的，我听到人的膝盖骨磕在瓷砖上的声音，“当”的一下，很脆。

translation: I could hardly understand why a nearly 70-year-old elder would kneel down in front of a 24-year-old man.
transcript: 那一年我24岁，我就不明白一个将近70岁的老人他为什么会跪在我的面前。

translation: It was due to my identity—a journalist.
transcript: 因为我有一个身份，我叫记者。

translation: In their eyes, a journalist is the modern equivalent of Bao Qingtian, an upright government officer in the Song Dynasty.
transcript: 在他们看来那个就叫包青天。

translation: Since then I began to realize that the society was full of unfairness.
transcript: 所以我开始理解，这个社会不是平的，也不是公平的。

translation: Next, I will talk about the year of 2003.
transcript: 接下来说说我的2003年。

translation: That year was very unusual.
transcript: 这一年很不一样。

translation: I directed a large live program named Competition on Mount Hua by Jin Yong, the pen at the television station.
transcript: 这一年我在电视台做了一档大型的现场直播节目，叫做《金庸华山论剑》。

translation: Although Jin Yong invented the term of Competition on Mount Hua, he had never been to Mount Hua in person.
transcript: 他发明了这个成语，华山论剑，可是他从来没有去过华山。

translation: Taking the chance of that program, we had the honour to invite Jin Yong to Mount Hua for the first time.
transcript: 我们做这个节目第一次把金庸带到了陕西华山。

translation: He even reached the top of Mount Hua.
transcript: 他上到了山顶。

translation: Before the program, we mobilized 5 newspaper offices to screen out some Jin Yong's fans, who then were given the chance to talk to Jin Yong face to face at Mount Hua.
transcript: 嗯，在做这个节目之前，我们联动了中国大概东西南北中的五家重要的报纸，去遴选出一些金庸迷，带到了华山的现场跟他对话。

translation: There was a 5-year-old child who looked very smart and cute, resembling the Tintin in The Adventures of Tintin.
transcript: 其中选出了一个五岁的小孩子，这小孩子长得非常机灵，很漂亮，很像那个《丁丁历险记》里头的丁丁。

translation: After becoming close friends, I asked him "what will you ask Jin Yong when you see him?"
transcript: 然后熟了以后我就问他，我说：“那你如果见到金庸你想问他什么问题呢？”

translation: The child replied: "I wonder how many people he can take on at one time."
transcript: 这孩子说：“我想问他，他一次能打几个人。”

translation: That was an excellent question.
transcript: 真是一个好问题，非常棒。

translation: It made me think why I couldn't come up with that question.
transcript: 我就在想为什么我问不出这样的问题呢。

translation: What happened between human nature and society?
transcript: 人性和社会之间到底发生了什么？

translation: Then I thought the society had taken away my innocence, making me complicated.
transcript: 后来我想我被社会变得复杂了，我没那么简单，所以我就没那么单纯。

translation: This kid really asked this question to Jin Yong, then he answered "I can't fight anyone".
transcript: 噢，这个孩子在现场问了他，他说：“我一个人也打不了。”

translation: The child continued "if so, why do you say you are a knight-errant?"
transcript: 那孩子说：“那你为什么说你是大侠呢？”

translation: He said "I just write in my book that a knight-errant who is great shall fight for his country and people".
transcript: 他说：“我在书里写，‘侠之大者，为国为民’。

translation: That question was beyond the child's apprehension, and not to his taste.
transcript: 孩子没听懂，不喜欢他这个答案。

translation: Well, since I am an adult, I must ask something profound.
transcript: 嗯，我不是孩子，所以我要问一个高级一点的问题。

translation: But, what am I going to ask?
transcript: 问什么呢？

translation: In addition to martial arts and chivalry, there are also many love stories in Jing Yong's novels.
transcript: 除了武侠还有一块叫做爱情。

translation: So I asked him "what kind of love is perfect in your eyes since you have written countless love stories in your novels?"
transcript: 我说：“你写了那么多的爱情，那你认为最完美的爱情是什么？”

translation: According to my memory, he once said that he was moved to tears whilst writing some specific love stories.
transcript: 因为在此之前他写了一段话，他说，他写了那么多的爱情里面，曾经写到自己心动落泪的。

translation: Then I wondered what they were.
transcript: 是什么呢。

translation: Jin Yong cried when writing the farewell scene between Zhang Wuji and Xiao Zhao.
transcript: 张无忌跟小昭告别的时候，金庸哭了。

translation: Jin Yong cried when writing the scene that Xiao Feng killed A Zhu by mistake.
transcript: 写到萧峰一掌打死阿朱的时候，金庸哭了。

translation: Jin Yong cried when writing the scene that Xiaolongnv didn't show up as agreed with Yang Guo 16 years ago, leaving Yang Guo to wait alongside the Duanchang Cliff till sunset. That day stifles all hopes Yang Guo has to his world.
transcript: 写到杨过跟小龙女相约16年后，断肠崖下见的时候，杨过一直等到太阳落山，小龙女没来，那个是杨过的世界末日，金庸哭了。

translation: I asked him "Do you still feel sad when reading those scenes again?"
transcript: 嗯，我说：“你现在再看这些你还会难过吗？”

translation: He answered "Yes".
transcript: 他说：“难过的。”

translation: "What does the most ideal love look like in your eyes?" , I continued.
transcript: 我说：“那你认为最理想的爱情是什么样呢？”。

translation: He gave me a short answer, "fall in love at first sight, live to old age in conjugal bliss and be loyal to each other until death".
transcript: 他说：“一见钟情，白头偕老，从一而终。”就这12个字。

translation: Then, up to no good, I asked him "Are you one of those who have followed that standard?"
transcript: 那接着我就很不厚道地问：“那你自己是这样吗？”

translation: How will he reply?
transcript: 他会怎么答呢？

translation: Let your imagination run free.
transcript: 你们想想。

translation: In front of the close-up shot, he said, "No, I'm a man with a low moral standard".
transcript: 我们的镜头给了一个特写，他说：“我不是，我是一个道德很不好的人。”

translation: Actually, he said so when we were broadcasting live.
transcript: 我们现场直播，他这么讲。

translation: Normally, every TV television will keep a record of audience rating.
transcript: 那电视台会有收视率调查嘛。

translation: That conversation set the highest audience rating among the over 4-hour long program.
transcript: 这一段在我们整个四个多小时的直播里面收视率是最高的。

translation: That interview helped me understand one truth, which doesn’t indicate the complicated human nature or unfair society.
transcript: 这让我明白了一个道理，不是人性是复杂的，也不是社会是不公平的。

translation: What is it?
transcript: 它是什么呢？

translation: The truth is that obstacles will always remain there, regardless of whether you escape or not.
transcript: 问题永远都在，逃避不了，逃避是没有用的，它还会出现。

translation: For years I have been asking questions since that interview.
transcript: 到现在这么多年过去我依然在提问。

translation: Why? There are still many mistakes between me and this world we are in, and it is also because of those mistakes that enable me to feel the greatness of this world.
transcript: 就是因为我跟这个社会，跟这个世界依然有很多很多的误解，这也让我看出这个世界的伟大之处。

translation: See, how distinctive we are.
transcript: 你看我们是那么不一样的人。

translation: The people who are present here and who will watch this video can live together in harmony, despite of their distinctiveness.
transcript: 今天在这里的，包括将来看我们这个视频的，都是那么那么不一样的人，但是我们却可以温柔的共存。

translation: What should we do if we, being distinctive, want to live together?
transcript: 就是因为我们彼此不同，而我们又想要在一起，那我们应该怎么办呢？

translation: The solution is to seek understanding.
transcript: 就是要寻求理解。

translation: I often feel that it is easy to fall in love, find a suitable job and succeed in your line of business, but it is really difficult to be understood.
transcript: 而我常常觉得，其实你遇到爱情很容易，遇到事业很容易，遇到成功很容易，可是遇到理解是非常非常难的。

translation: Achieving mutual understanding is really scarce.
transcript: 这是很稀罕的一件事儿。

translation: Hence, how do we start to understand each other?
transcript: 怎么开始理解彼此呢？

translation: While bringing about mistakes, in most cases, words are also a useful resort to eliminate mistakes.
transcript: 语言带来那么多的误会，可是我们往往也要靠语言来解决这些误会。

translation: As a consequence, there is no better choice but to ask questions haunting me most one after one.
transcript: 所以到现在我也没有更好的办法，我只能一个又一个地提问，问出我心中最不能理解的东西。

translation: Today's speech starts with a question of mine, so it is best to end it with a question too.
transcript: 今天的演讲呢，从我有一个问题开始，最好也要从我有一个问题结束。

translation: But I am contemplating what to ask.
transcript: 可我在想我有什么问题呢。

translation: If I were from the China Central Television, I would ask "Are you happy?"
transcript: 如果是中央电视台，他会问：“你幸福吗？”

translation: "Yes, I am happy!".
transcript: “我幸福！”。

translation: I do believe that I am happy right now.
transcript: 呵呵，我想想看我真的挺幸福的。

translation: If there is a question I want to ask at the end of this speech, that will be "Do you deserve the happiness that you have?"
transcript: 可是如果这个问题让我在最后提出来的话，我想说的就是，“你配得上幸福吗？”

translation: Thanks!
transcript: 谢谢大家！
